title: Vector Style
description: A 3D Tiles style with additional properties for vector data.

show.description: Whether or not to show the feature.

color.description: The color of the point. `color` is ignored when `image` is defined.

pointSize.description: The size of the point in pixels. `pointSize` is ignored when `image` is defined.

pointOutlineColor.description: The color of the point outline. `pointOutlineColor` is ignored when `image` is defined.

pointOutlineWidth.description: The width of the point outline in pixels. `pointOutlineWidth` is ignored when `image` is defined.

labelText.description:
The text to display for the point. `'
'` can be added to separate lines of text.

labelColor.description: The color of the label's text.

labelOutlineColor.description: The color of the text outline.

labelOutlineWidth.description: The width of the text outline in pixels.

font.description: The font of the displayed text.

backgroundPadding.description: The background padding, in pixels, of this label.  The `x` value controls horizontal padding, and the `y` value controls vertical padding. The number of `x` pixels is added to both sides. The number of `y` pixels is added to the top and bottom.

backgroundEnabled.description: Whether or not to display the label background.

scaleByDistance.description: Sets near and far scaling properties of a feature based on the features's distance from the camera in meters. A feature's scale will interpolate between the `y` and `w` values while the camera distance falls within the lower, `x`, and upper, `z`, bounds. Outside of these ranges, the features's scale remains clamped to the nearest bound.  If undefined, `scaleByDistance` will be disabled.

translucencyByDistance.description: Sets near and far translucency properties of a feature based on the feature's distance from the camera in meters. Translucency describes how transparent the point will be, where `0.0` means the point is completely transparant and `1.0` means the point is completely opaque. A feature's translucency will interpolate between the `y` and `w` while the camera distance falls within the upper and lower bounds of the specified `x` and `z`. Outside of these ranges the feature's translucency remains clamped to the nearest bound.  If undefined, `translucencyByDistance` will be disabled.

distanceDisplayCondition.description: Sets the condition specifying at what distance from the camera in meters that this feature will be displayed. The `x` value is the smallest distance in the interval where the feature is visible. The `y` value is the largest distance in the interval where the object is visible. If undefined, `distanceDisplayCondition` will be disabled.

heightOffset.description: The distance, in meters, to offset the height from the original height of the point. This is ignored if the value is less than or equal to zero.

anchorLineEnabled.description: Whether or not to display a line from the feature to the point's original position. This is ignored unless `heightOffset` is greater than zero.

anchorLineColor.description: The color of the line from the feature to the point's original position. This is ignored unless `heightOffset` is greater than 0.0.

image.description: A URL to an image or a data URI to be displayed instead of a point.

disableDepthTestDistance.description: The distance from the camera in meters at which to disable the depth test to, for example, prevent clipping against terrain. When set to zero or `undefined`, the depth test is always applied. When set to Number.POSITIVE_INFINITY, the depth test is never applied.

horizontalOrigin.description: The horizontal origin of the point: **center** (`0`), **left** (`1`), or **right** (`-1`).

verticalOrigin.description: The vertical origin of the point: **center** (`0`), **Bottom** (`1`), or **top** (`-1`).

labelHorizontalOrigin.description: The horizontal origin of the label: **center** (`0`), **left** (`1`), or **right** (`-1`).

labelVerticalOrigin.description: The vertical origin of the label: **center** (`0`), **bottom** (`1`), **top** (`-1`), or **baseline** (`2`).
